content.explanation:
The DOMAIN is the complete set of all possible input values (x-values) that a function can accept.

Think of domain like a restaurant menu:
üçΩÔ∏è The menu shows everything you CAN order (domain)
üö´ You can't order items not on the menu

Some functions accept any number as input, while others have restrictions. For example, you can't take the square root of a negative number (in real numbers), so ‚àöx has domain restrictions.
content.example:
üì± Real-world domains:
‚Ä¢ Phone battery level function: 0% to 100%
‚Ä¢ Age-based ticket prices: 0 to 120+ years
‚Ä¢ Video game score: 0 to unlimited points
‚Ä¢ Temperature in Kelvin: 0 K to unlimited
content.key_point: Domain = all x-values the function can handle without breaking.

interactive.question: What's the most reasonable domain for a function that calculates movie ticket price based on age?
